name: Basic Accessibility Test
description: Tests basic accessibility features of a website

steps.description: Check if the page has a proper title element
steps.expected: The page should have a descriptive title
steps.reasoning: A title is important for SEO and accessibility, helping users understand the page content quickly.

steps.description: Verify all images have alt text
steps.expected: All images should have alternative text descriptions
steps.reasoning: Alt text ensures that visually impaired users using screen readers can understand image content.

steps.description: Check if form fields have associated labels
steps.expected: Input fields should have proper labels or aria-labels
steps.reasoning: Labels provide context to form fields, ensuring usability for screen readers.

steps.description: Verify heading structure is hierarchical (h1 followed by h2, etc.)
steps.expected: Headings should follow a logical hierarchy
steps.reasoning: A proper heading structure improves page navigation and readability for all users, including those using assistive technology.

steps.description: Check color contrast of text against backgrounds
steps.expected: Text should have sufficient contrast with its background
steps.reasoning: Good contrast ensures readability, especially for users with visual impairments.

steps.description: Test keyboard navigation through main interactive elements
steps.expected: All interactive elements should be reachable and usable with keyboard
steps.reasoning: Keyboard accessibility is essential for users who cannot use a mouse, ensuring they can navigate the site effectively.
